settings.title: Popup
settings.content: You can use this popup to display some useful information to your customers.

settings.title: Aria Health
settings.text:
Compression therapy that
fits your life, and a device
that fits in your pocket.

settings.title:
Less machine.
More you.
settings.product_title: A simpler, friendlier approach to therapy.
settings.product_description: Introducing a compression pump that’s about the size and weight of a smartphone + a streamlined garment with a modern fit and design. Now therapy is easy, with just one hose to connect—and most importantly: disconnect. So answer the door, pick up the baby, head to the bathroom. No more building your life around therapy. Just automated compression massage at the touch of a button, and remote coaching to keep everything on track.

settings.quote: Being able to pause it and walk to the door is a plus.
Feels similar to the compression stockings I have on.
A hundred times more comfortable and less bulky.

settings.title: Portable and packable, for what’s possible.
settings.text: Wherever you go, Aria Free goes. With smart, flexible therapy, and an app to reach your goals, you’re in control.

settings.form_description: Stay connected to all the Aria Health news. You’ll also receive updates, offers, and details about feedback opportunities. We’re doing something different, together.

settings.title: Designed to be different.
settings.text: We’ve learned that you can’t just treat problems—you have to treat people. So we created a better therapy experience. While most pneumatic compression therapy equipment can be cumbersome, the compact Aria Free system is portable, targeting the burden and isolation of therapy.

settings.quote: I love the small pump. Easy. Very easy.
Pleasantly surprised that it worked so well.
A hundred times more comfortable and less bulky.

settings.title: Aria Free goes where you go.
settings.text: Aria Free is the perfect traveling companion. Get a portable pump for therapy on the go—without sacrificing performance.

settings.form_description: Stay connected to all the Aria Health news. You'll hear about updates, offers, and opportunities. We’re doing something different, together.

settings.title: We are Aria Health.
settings.text:
Advancing technology,
building community, and
bringing a personal focus
to therapy.
settings.desc:
We’re working to provide freedom and flexibility
to the millions of people facing the challenges
and burdens of treating lymphedema and other
chronic edema conditions.

settings.heading:
Big idea.
Little pump.
settings.title: How can technology transform healthcare?
settings.text: This was the question posed by our parent company, ResMed, at the outset of a 2017 innovation challenge. Among those who took on the task: Dinesh Ramanan, a biomedical engineer in ResMed’s clinical science and innovation department. Dinesh proposed the concept for what is now Aria Free. Since that time, the Aria team has grown, and we’ve had the occasion to meet so many inspiring people who’ve shared firsthand knowledge to help us develop a little device we think can change therapy in a big way.

settings.title: Brooke Harding
settings.bio: As the General Manager of Aria Health, Brooke brings a wealth of expertise gained over a sixteen year ResMed career including: leading commercial teams and corporate strategy with an emphasis on growth strategy, business model innovation, new markets and market disruption. Most recently, Brooke created and led the New Business Innovation team, developing transformational business concepts into new businesses, including Aria Health. Brooke is passionate about driving change, particularly around belonging, inclusion, diversity and equity, and this permeates throughout all of her work, both on the job and in her communities.

settings.title: Eric Saunders
settings.bio: Eric applies his energy and experience in many ways as he leads regulatory and operations for Aria Health. After receiving a bachelor of engineering and an MBA, Eric joined McKinsey consulting where he advised senior leadership across multiple companies on how to successfully bring new products to market. Eric joined ResMed in 2017 to find promising new healthcare innovations and develop those projects in collaboration with patients and clinicians. As a founding member of Aria Health he is very much looking forward to bringing a new and simple experience to market and supporting those in the lymphedema community.

settings.title: Dinesh Ramanan
settings.bio: Dinesh is responsible for the product development and clinical innovation behind Aria Health. Prior to his work with Aria Health, Dinesh was a key member of the clinical science and innovation team within ResMed, and he combines over ten years of medical device experience with his master’s degree in biomedical engineering to elevate our team’s capabilities. The innovator behind the product, Dinesh credits a family member living with venous disease as his inspiration. His passion for helping people is also evident in the six years he managed fundraising efforts for a nonprofit focused on developing better healthcare solutions for those living in rural India.

settings.title: Jeannine Mar
settings.bio: With over thirteen years of experience in the health tech industry, Jeannine leads the commercial efforts for Aria Health. Since 2012, she’s worked in marketing and strategy roles across ResMed’s portfolio of medical devices and out-of-hospital software. She also brings a scientific perspective to her position at Aria Health, with both an MBA and a bachelor of science in molecular biology. Jeannine is eager to apply her knowledge, and hopeful that Aria Health will positively impact people’s lives by transforming the treatment of lymphedema and other chronic edema conditions.

settings.title: Gordon Malouf
settings.bio: Gordon is the project manager for Aria Health product development. He brings to the position over twenty years of experience in inventing and releasing innovative medical devices to market. Gordon’s career has spanned multiple roles and continents, having worked in technology development, clinical engineering research, system engineering, product marketing, and medical affairs across Sweden, Australia, Japan, and Singapore. He holds bachelor's degrees in computer science and mechatronics engineering, and is passionate about applying his education and expertise to help improve healthcare and quality of life. Gordon is excited to see the impact Aria can have on the world of lymphedema.

settings.title: Kimm Ehlen
settings.bio: Kimm oversees community outreach and manages all of our events. Her input on product development is an invaluable asset to the Aria Health team, as she shares her personal experience living with lymphedema. It was after cancer treatment that Kimm experienced the onset of secondary lymphedema. The subsequent physical limitations made her life unrecognizable, but in a testament to her resilience, she managed her symptoms and reclaimed her active lifestyle. Today, she shares her experience in support of others as they do the same. Kimm brings optimism and dedication to our team, as well as her passion for photography—many of her photographs appear on our website and social accounts. If you have thoughts to share about Aria Free, reach out to Kimm.

settings.title: Amy Cook
settings.bio: Amy is responsible for Aria Health digital solutions. She joined Aria Health after seven years working with ResMed’s connected medical devices. She brings a science and business education to the team, with over ten years designing software to deliver exceptional patient experiences. She’s passionate about problem solving, and is excited to put her efforts and expertise with digital tools and support toward enabling successful therapy. If you engage with the Aria app, you will see Amy’s work firsthand. Her favorite part of working with digital solutions is that they can always be changed if you don’t get it right the first time—so she wants to hear from the community so we can keep making improvements!

settings.title: Backed by ResMed.
settings.text: Aria Free was developed in association with ResMed, our parent company. For thirty years, ResMed has been a leader in health technology, transforming care for people with sleep apnea, COPD, and other chronic diseases. The company continues to make an impact with cloud-connected medical devices and out-of-hospital software solutions that deliver quality outcomes and quality of life for healthcare providers and those they serve.

settings.title: Exceptionally engineered
settings.description: Low-pressure pump, designed to be petite yet powerful.

settings.title: Seriously smart
settings.description: Remote coaching, notifications, and daily progress tracking all accessible via mobile app.

settings.title: Quick and easy
settings.description: Slip-on garment, one-button start, simple connect/disconnect, in-app instructions.

settings.title: Super portable
settings.description: Streamlined garment and small compression pump go wherever you go.

settings.title: Innovative quality
settings.description: Backed by 30 years of ResMed’s health technology leadership.

settings.quote: Pleasantly surprised that it worked so well.
Looking forward to using it and telling people about it.
This system would be amazing to travel with.

settings.title: General information
settings.description:
New to Aria Free? Here are some
things you want to know.

settings.title: Current customers
settings.description:
Find videos, manuals, customer
service, FAQ, tips, and more.

settings.form_description: Stay connected to all the Aria Health news. You’ll also receive updates, offers, and details about feedback opportunities. We’re doing something different, together.

settings.title: 1. Take the Aria survey.
settings.text: Answer just a few questions to see if Aria Free is right for you.
settings.image_label: Lourienne, primary lymphedema and Atara, secondary lymphedema

settings.title: 2. Find your garment size.
settings.text: Our simple 3-measurement sizing chart will identify the right fit.

settings.title: 3. Get your Rx ready.
settings.text: You’ll need a prescription for therapy. If you already have one, you can upload or fax it to us. If you need one, ask your healthcare provider.

settings.title: 4. Get free contactless delivery to your door and a 30-day money-back guarantee.
settings.text: Your Aria Free system comes with everything you need to get started and set up on your own. We are available by phone or online for help, and there’s no need for anyone to come to your home. That’s it!

settings.title: How to get Aria
settings.subtitle: It’s easy: just four quick steps.

settings.title: Flexible rental payment plan options at 6, 12 and 18 months
Free service and support during rental period
Own your Aria Free system after rental payment term
Using your HSA or FSA.
settings.text: Aria Health does not contract directly with insurance companies or Medicare, but we can provide the necessary documentation to receive reimbursement if plans offer coverage. Some HSA/FSA agreements and insurance companies can help you pay for pneumatic compression devices.

settings.title: You must be in a qualified state to purchase Aria Free.
Kathleen H. Lisson
settings.bio: Kathleen Lisson is board certified in therapeutic massage and bodywork and is a Certified Lymphedema Therapist. From her practice in San Diego, Kathleen provides her patients manual lymphatic drainage for post-surgical swelling and fibrosis as well as lymphedema and lipedema massage. Kathleen is also theauthor of multiple books on manual lymphatic drainage and the management of swelling.

settings.title: Dr. Harvey N. Mayrovitz
settings.bio: Dr.Harvey N. Mayrovitz is a professor in the Department of Medical Educationat the Dr.Kiran C. Patel College of Allopathic Medicine at Nova Southeastern University in Davie, Florida. His over 150 peer-reviewed publications include areas in skin physiology, lymphedema, wound healing, and the investigation of techniques for diagnosis and monitoring.

settings.title: Emilia Dewi
settings.bio: Emilia Dewi is an occupational therapist and lymphedema and cancer rehabilitation specialist at a leading rehabilitation hospital in Houston, Texas. As a Doctorate of Occupational Therapy and a Certified Lymphedema Therapist, Emilia works with clients who have neurological conditions, cancer, lymphedema, and multi-trauma injuries. Emilia's personalized treatment approach includes lifestyle adaptation to enable her clients manage their lymphedema.

settings.title: Dr. Emily Iker
settings.bio: Dr.Emily Iker is the former President of the American Society of Lymphology and the Director of The Lymphedema Center in Santa Monica. As a Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation Specialist, Dr.Iker brings her personal experience of lymphedema and over 20 years of practice to the care of her patients through individualized treatment plans, manual lymphatic drainage, self-massage, and compression therapy.
